main event: Unidentified flying objects were sighted in Fort Worth, Texas on multiple occasions in 1954, displaying unusual behaviors and characteristics.
interesting points: One of the objects changed color from red to white to blue and back, and disappeared shortly before midnight, coinciding with the disappearance of Jupiter.

A T-33 jet aircraft was dispatched to investigate an unknown object picked up by radar, but the pilot was unable to overtake the 30-40 feet in diameter, bright, round, and white object moving at an estimated speed of 500 knots.

A separate observation reported by Capt. GALLAGER, Capt. THOMPSON, and Capt. SPARKS described an unidentified flying object traveling in a westerly direction at about 2240 hours on 13 April 1954, estimated to be about 30 to 40 feet in diameter, and wobbling as it moved with no exhaust or trail visible.
The sighting by a separate group of witnesses involved an object moving at a high rate of speed, not following any known air traffic pattern, and without any sound or visible exhaust or trail.
The report was considered significant enough to warrant further investigation, as indicated by the request for additional investigation by the office.
photographs: no photographs included in the report
